questions.question: What is the main advantage of using Lasso Regression over Linear Regression?

answers.b: It automatically selects important features by setting some coefficients to zero.
answers.d: It increases the number of coefficients in the model.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Lasso focuses on regularization, not speeding up training.
explanations.b: Correct! Lasso performs feature selection by shrinking some coefficients to zero.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Lasso may increase bias due to regularization.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Lasso actually reduces unnecessary coefficients.

questions.question: How does increasing the alpha value in Ridge Regression affect the model?

answers.a: It increases the magnitude of coefficients.
answers.b: It decreases the magnitude of coefficients.
answers.c: It has no effect on the model.

explanations.b: Correct! A higher alpha increases regularization, shrinking coefficients.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Alpha directly controls regularization strength.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Ridge never eliminates coefficients completely; only Lasso can.

questions.question: Which statement correctly describes the role of alpha in Lasso and Ridge Regression?

answers.a: Higher alpha values reduce overfitting by increasing regularization.
answers.b: Alpha has no impact on model generalization.
answers.c: Lower alpha values decrease model flexibility.
answers.d: Alpha controls the learning rate of the model.

explanations.a: Correct! Higher alpha increases regularization strength and reduces overfitting.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Alpha greatly impacts model complexity and generalization.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Lower alpha reduces regularization, making the model more flexible.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Alpha is not related to the learning rate.

questions.question: Which model is most suitable when predictors are highly correlated?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Linear Regression performs poorly with multicollinearity.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Lasso may arbitrarily eliminate correlated features.
explanations.c: Correct! Ridge handles multicollinearity effectively by distributing coefficient weights.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Ridge is specifically designed to handle this scenario.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Linear Regression?

answers.a: A model that always sets some coefficients to zero.
answers.b: A model that establishes a linear relationship without any regularization.
answers.c: A regularized model that uses L2 penalty.
answers.d: A nonlinear model suitable only for classification.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Only Lasso sets coefficients to zero.
explanations.b: Correct! Linear Regression has no regularization by default.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Linear Regression is a regression model, not classification.

questions.question: Which model is most likely to produce a sparse solution (many coefficients becoming zero)?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Linear Regression does not shrink coefficients.
explanations.b: Correct! Lassoâ€™s L1 penalty forces some coefficients to zero.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Ridge reduces magnitude but never sets coefficients to zero.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Ridge does not produce sparsity.
